question-text: State TRUE or FALSE to the following statements. Do not copy the statements.

set1.question-item-text: Food is one of the major requiements of life.
DNA polymerase replicates the two original strands differently.
Most transpiration takes place through the stomata.
Plant parasitic nematodes have a style, a piercing mouthpart.
A plant hormone is an inorganic compound.
Pollution is a growing threat on both land and in aquatic ecosystems.
The blood and bone of animals are also used as fertilizer.
The two strands of a RNA molecule are antiparallel.
Almost all arteries carry deoxygenated blood.
All bacteria are bad for plants and soil.

set2.question-item-text: Commercially cultivating agricultural crops in Myanmar are mainly cereals, pulses and oilseed crops.
The study of chemical, physical structures, and functions of biological microorganisms is known as molecular biology.
When leaves photosynthesize, they produce carbohydrates.
Oxygen is supplied to the heart muscle by the coronary arteries.
Hypogeal germination takes place above the ground.
The diverse habitats are home for a wide range of species.
Domain Bacteria and Eukarya consist of prokaryotes.
The genetically modified rice is called Golden Rice.
The muscular wall of the right ventricle is much thicker than that of the left.
All plants are attacked by one species or another of phytopathogenic bacteria and viruses.

set3.question-item-text: Biology is broadly divided into five major themes.
The two main classes of nucleic acids are deoxyribonucleic acid and ribonucleic acid.
Phloem tissue contains cells called mesophyll.
The development of atherosclerosis is linked to many types of cancers.
Genetic factors are not involved in overall maintenance of a plant.
Artificial insemination technique used in captive breeding programmes.
Spider silk is referred to by many scientists as bio-steel.
The two strands of a DNA molecule are parallel.
Platelets are tiny fragments of large cells called megakaryocytes.
Bacteria are most active in warm and humid environments.

set4.question-item-text: Evolution is the process of change that has transformed
Fish farming or pisciculture involves commercial harvesting life on earth.
DNA replication is the making of an exact copy of the DAN molecule.
Glucose can be moved through the xylem as part of the sucrose molecule.
The open circulatory system is found in most arthropods.
Signs of plant disease are physiological evidence of the pathogen.
Oxgen is supplied to the heart muscle by the coronary arteries.
Growth regulators are manufactured by dead protoplasm.
The diverse habitats are home for a narrow range of species.
Wildlife trade can involve the trade of living or dead individuals.
